sentences.en: Beneath his choleric exterior Gerald O'Hara had the tenderest of hearts.
sentences.cn: 杰拉尔德?欧哈拉的外相虽然凶恨,心里却是再和气不过.

sentences.en: Choleric people don't cry easily or show much emotion at all.
sentences.cn: 暴躁的人不会轻易哭泣,或显露过多的情绪.

sentences.en: Criminally offensive, weak in self - restraint on criminal impulse and choleric.
sentences.cn: 犯罪攻击性强 、 犯罪 自我 的内心控制力弱、性情狂暴.

sentences.en: From a choleric man withdraw a little; form him that says nothing, for ever.
sentences.cn: 同易动气的人离远点; 同不开口的人别打交道.

sentences.en: He was affable at one moment, choleric the next.
sentences.cn: 他一会儿还和蔼可亲，可一转眼就火冒三丈。

sentences.en: Hippocrates: Because of an excess of black bile and a deficiency of choleric humour.
sentences.cn: 希波克拉底: 由于黑胆汁分泌过多而胆汁分泌不足.

sentences.en: His pride and choleric temper were to ruin him.
sentences.cn: 他生性高傲自恃而又易于发怒,这会毁了他的.

sentences.en: How did a choleric chef regain his reputation after attacking a kitchen staff?
sentences.cn: 坏脾气的厨子如何在袭击员工后赚回声誉?

sentences.en: In style, Mr McCain's reaction was slow and choleric, while Mr Obama's was steely and swift.
sentences.cn: 在风度上, 麦凯恩先生的反应迟缓、暴躁, 而奥巴马先生的反应则坚定、迅速.

sentences.en: Men of the choleric type take to kicking and smashing.
sentences.cn: 易怒的人喜欢乱踢东西和摔碎东西.

sentences.en: Paul was a choleric. Jeremiah was a melancholy.
sentences.cn: 彼得热情乐观，保罗暴躁易怒，耶利米多愁善感。

sentences.en: The choleric face distorts in a look of puzzlement.
sentences.cn: 那张暴躁的脸孔蹙了起来,显得有些迷惑.

sentences.en: There was NO vulgar bullying, NO bravado of any sort, NO choleric hectoring…
sentences.cn: 没有低级庸俗的恃强欺弱，没有任何形式的虚张声势，没有怒气冲冲的威胁恐吓…

sentences.en: Words like confident, independent and motivated describe choleric people.
sentences.cn: 像自信 、 独立和充满干劲之类的字眼,都可形容暴躁的人.

words.tran_cn: 易怒的；暴躁的；胆汁质的

trans.tran_en: A choleric person gets angry very easily. You can also use choleric to describe a person who is very angry.
